intro: Ditassa warmingii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces violet or purple flowers that bloom in spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers indirect sunlight, making it a popular houseplant.
